verses.verse: And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD<WH3068>: and the LORD<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of Midian<WH4080> seven<WH7651> years<WH8141>.

And the hand<WH3027> of Midian<WH4080> prevailed<WH5810> against Israel<WH3478>: and because<WH6440> of the Midianites<WH4080> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> made<WH6213> them the dens<WH4492> which are in the mountains<WH2022>, and caves<WH4631>, and strong holds<WH4679>. prevailed: Heb. was strong

And so it was, when Israel<WH3478> had sown<WH2232>, that the Midianites<WH4080> came up<WH5927>, and the Amalekites<WH6002>, and the children<WH1121> of the east<WH6924>, even they came up<WH5927> against them;

And they encamped<WH2583> against them, and destroyed<WH7843> the increase<WH2981> of the earth<WH776>, till thou come<WH935> unto Gaza<WH5804>, and left<WH7604> no sustenance<WH4241> for Israel<WH3478>, neither sheep<WH7716>, nor ox<WH7794>, nor ass<WH2543>. sheep: or goat

For they came up<WH5927> with their cattle<WH4735> and their tents<WH168>, and they came<WH935> <WH935> as<WH1767> grasshoppers<WH697> for multitude<WH7230>; for both they and their camels<WH1581> were without number<WH4557>: and they entered<WH935> into the land<WH776> to destroy<WH7843> it.
And Israel<WH3478> was greatly<WH3966> impoverished<WH1809> because<WH6440> of the Midianites<WH4080>; and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH2199> unto the LORD<WH3068>.
And it came to pass, when the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH2199> unto the LORD<WH3068> because<WH182> of the Midianites<WH4080>,

That the LORD<WH3068> sent<WH7971> a prophet<WH376> <WH5030> unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, which said<WH559> unto them, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, I brought you up<WH5927> from Egypt<WH4714>, and brought you forth<WH3318> out of the house<WH1004> of bondage<WH5650>; a prophet: Heb. a man a prophet

And I delivered<WH5337> you out of the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>, and out of the hand<WH3027> of all that oppressed<WH3905> you, and drave them out<WH1644> from before<WH6440> you, and gave<WH5414> you their land<WH776>;

And I said<WH559> unto you, I am the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>; fear<WH3372> not the gods<WH430> of the Amorites<WH567>, in whose land<WH776> ye dwell<WH3427>: but ye have not obeyed<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>.

And there came<WH935> an angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068>, and sat<WH3427> under an oak<WH424> which was in Ophrah<WH6084>, that pertained unto Joash<WH3101> the Abiezrite<WH33>: and his son<WH1121> Gideon<WH1439> threshed<WH2251> wheat<WH2406> by the winepress<WH1660>, to hide<WH5127> it from<WH6440> the Midianites<WH4080>. Gideon: Gr. Gedeon to hide: Heb. to cause it to flee
And the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> unto him, and said<WH559> unto him, The LORD<WH3068> is with thee, thou mighty<WH1368> man of valour<WH2428>.

And Gideon<WH1439> said<WH559> unto him, Oh<WH994> my Lord<WH113>, if<WH3426> the LORD<WH3068> be with us, why then is all this befallen<WH4672> us? and where be all his miracles<WH6381> which our fathers<WH1> told<WH5608> us of, saying<WH559>, Did not the LORD<WH3068> bring us up<WH5927> from Egypt<WH4714>? but now the LORD<WH3068> hath forsaken<WH5203> us, and delivered<WH5414> us into the hands<WH3709> of the Midianites<WH4080>.

And the LORD<WH3068> looked<WH6437> upon him, and said<WH559>, Go<WH3212> in this thy might<WH3581>, and thou shalt save<WH3467> Israel<WH3478> from the hand<WH3709> of the Midianites<WH4080>: have not I sent<WH7971> thee?

And he said<WH559> unto him, Oh<WH994> my Lord<WH136>, wherewith<WH4100> shall I save<WH3467> Israel<WH3478>? behold, my family<WH504> <WH505> is poor<WH1800> in Manasseh<WH4519>, and I am the least<WH6810> in my father's<WH1> house<WH1004>. my family: Heb. my thousand is the meanest
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him, Surely I will be with thee, and thou shalt smite<WH5221> the Midianites<WH4080> as one<WH259> man<WH376>.
And he said<WH559> unto him, If now I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>, then shew<WH6213> me a sign<WH226> that thou talkest<WH1696> with me.

Depart<WH4185> not hence, I pray thee, until I come<WH935> unto thee, and bring forth<WH3318> my present<WH4503>, and set<WH3240> it before<WH6440> thee. And he said<WH559>, I will tarry<WH3427> until thou come again<WH7725>. present: or, meat offering

And Gideon<WH1439> went in<WH935>, and made ready<WH6213> a kid<WH5795> <WH1423>, and unleavened cakes<WH4682> of an ephah<WH374> of flour<WH7058>: the flesh<WH1320> he put<WH7760> in a basket<WH5536>, and he put<WH7760> the broth<WH4839> in a pot<WH6517>, and brought it out<WH3318> unto him under the oak<WH424>, and presented<WH5066> it. a kid: Heb. a kid of the goats

And the angel<WH4397> of God<WH430> said<WH559> unto him, Take<WH3947> the flesh<WH1320> and the unleavened cakes<WH4682>, and lay<WH3240> them upon this<WH1975> rock<WH5553>, and pour out<WH8210> the broth<WH4839>. And he did<WH6213> so.

Then the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> put forth<WH7971> the end<WH7097> of the staff<WH4938> that was in his hand<WH3027>, and touched<WH5060> the flesh<WH1320> and the unleavened cakes<WH4682>; and there rose up<WH5927> fire<WH784> out of the rock<WH6697>, and consumed<WH398> the flesh<WH1320> and the unleavened cakes<WH4682>. Then the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> departed<WH1980> out of his sight<WH5869>.

And when Gideon<WH1439> perceived<WH7200> that he was an angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068>, Gideon<WH1439> said<WH559>, Alas<WH162>, O Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>! for because<WH3651> I have seen<WH7200> an angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> face<WH6440> to face<WH6440>.
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him, Peace<WH7965> be unto thee; fear<WH3372> not: thou shalt not die<WH4191>.

Then Gideon<WH1439> built<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> there unto the LORD<WH3068>, and called<WH7121> it Jehovahshalom<WH3073>: unto this day<WH3117> it is yet in Ophrah<WH6084> of the Abiezrites<WH33>. Jehovahshalom: that is, The LORD send peace

And it came to pass the same night<WH3915>, that the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him, Take<WH3947> thy father's<WH1> young<WH6499> bullock<WH7794>, even the second<WH8145> bullock<WH6499> of seven<WH7651> years old<WH8141>, and throw down<WH2040> the altar<WH4196> of Baal<WH1168> that thy father<WH1> hath, and cut down<WH3772> the grove<WH842> that is by it: even: or, and

And build<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> upon the top<WH7218> of this rock<WH4581>, in the ordered place<WH4634>, and take<WH3947> the second<WH8145> bullock<WH6499>, and offer<WH5927> a burnt sacrifice<WH5930> with the wood<WH6086> of the grove<WH842> which thou shalt cut down<WH3772>. rock: Heb. strong place in the ordered: or, in an orderly manner

Then Gideon<WH1439> took<WH3947> ten<WH6235> men<WH582> of his servants<WH5650>, and did<WH6213> as the LORD<WH3068> had said<WH1696> unto him: and so it was, because he feared<WH3372> his father's<WH1> household<WH1004>, and the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892>, that he could not do<WH6213> it by day<WH3119>, that he did<WH6213> it by night<WH3915>.

And when the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892> arose early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, behold, the altar<WH4196> of Baal<WH1168> was cast down<WH5422>, and the grove<WH842> was cut down<WH3772> that was by it, and the second<WH8145> bullock<WH6499> was offered<WH5927> upon the altar<WH4196> that was built<WH1129>.

And they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH7453>, Who hath done<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>? And when they enquired<WH1875> and asked<WH1245>, they said<WH559>, Gideon<WH1439> the son<WH1121> of Joash<WH3101> hath done<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>.

Then the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892> said<WH559> unto Joash<WH3101>, Bring out<WH3318> thy son<WH1121>, that he may die<WH4191>: because he hath cast down<WH5422> the altar<WH4196> of Baal<WH1168>, and because he hath cut down<WH3772> the grove<WH842> that was by it.

And Joash<WH3101> said<WH559> unto all that stood<WH5975> against him, Will ye plead<WH7378> for Baal<WH1168>? will ye save<WH3467> him? he that will plead<WH7378> for him, let him be put to death<WH4191> whilst it is yet morning<WH1242>: if he be a god<WH430>, let him plead<WH7378> for himself, because one hath cast down<WH5422> his altar<WH4196>.

Therefore on that day<WH3117> he called<WH7121> him Jerubbaal<WH3378>, saying<WH559>, Let Baal<WH1168> plead<WH7378> against him, because he hath thrown down<WH5422> his altar<WH4196>. Jerubbaal: that is, Let Baal plead Jerubbesheth: that is, Let the shameful thing plead

Then all the Midianites<WH4080> and the Amalekites<WH6002> and the children<WH1121> of the east<WH6924> were gathered<WH622> together<WH3162>, and went over<WH5674>, and pitched<WH2583> in the valley<WH6010> of Jezreel<WH3157>.

But the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> came<WH3847> upon Gideon<WH1439>, and he blew<WH8628> a trumpet<WH7782>; and Abiezer<WH44> was gathered<WH2199> after<WH310> him. came: Heb. clothed gathered: Heb. called

And he sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> throughout all Manasseh<WH4519>; who also was gathered<WH2199> after<WH310> him: and he sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto Asher<WH836>, and unto Zebulun<WH2074>, and unto Naphtali<WH5321>; and they came up<WH5927> to meet<WH7125> them. gathered: Heb. called
And Gideon<WH1439> said<WH559> unto God<WH430>, If thou wilt<WH3426> save<WH3467> Israel<WH3478> by mine hand<WH3027>, as thou hast said<WH1696>,

Behold, I will put<WH3322> a fleece<WH1492> of wool<WH6785> in the floor<WH1637>; and if the dew<WH2919> be on the fleece<WH1492> only, and it be dry<WH2721> upon all the earth<WH776> beside, then shall I know<WH3045> that thou wilt save<WH3467> Israel<WH3478> by mine hand<WH3027>, as thou hast said<WH1696>.

And it was so: for he rose up early<WH7925> on the morrow<WH4283>, and thrust<WH2115> the fleece<WH1492> together<WH2115>, and wringed<WH4680> the dew<WH2919> out of the fleece<WH1492>, a bowl<WH5602> full<WH4393> of water<WH4325>.

And Gideon<WH1439> said<WH559> unto God<WH430>, Let not thine anger<WH639> be hot<WH2734> against me, and I will speak<WH1696> but this once<WH6471>: let me prove<WH5254>, I pray thee, but this once<WH6471> with the fleece<WH1492>; let it now be dry<WH2721> only upon the fleece<WH1492>, and upon all the ground<WH776> let there be dew<WH2919>.
And God<WH430> did<WH6213> so that night<WH3915>: for it was dry<WH2721> upon the fleece<WH1492> only, and there was dew<WH2919> on all the ground<WH776>.
